tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°Great Location but not ideal for a Family stay.  Rooms too small...Staff not friendly¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>Was extremely disappointed with the attitude from the staff especially at reception and dining.  It seems that every guest is considered to be dishonest and a thief.  Before even providing a service its about whether or not you have paid a deposit or settled your bill.  Its all about the money.  Felt extremely uncomfortable as a guest in the hotel.  The staff need to be a little more friendly and smile.......it costs nothing....but the lasting impression may be priceless<U+B207>The location is pretty great.  The family room was a  little too small and was difficult to move around...especially if you have luggage.  The Housekeeping service was excellent.  Breakfast was average...however not even a smile from the staff...most of them look like they are not happy working there.Stayed in January 2018

content_detail: <U+B209>Cons:Absolute ice cold pool ,noise from the air co engine at the top of the building,no place to relaxDirty floors with carpet and not so clean roomWeird way to have the room card every time with you ,otherwise no way to reach the 15 th floor where our room was or to take any other floorNo advise you have to playa bottom to allow the maid to make your roomAt 10.15 when we where back we asked the bar a cocktail or wine but it closes at 10 pm !!!you can only have beers<U+B207>Pros:Comfortable bed super sheetsSilent air coCentral location ,200 m to Nicolle highway and a couple of stops to the MarinaVery good breakfastFriendly staffStayed in January 2018

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: <U+B209>There was almost no cold water available in the bathroom. Arab district only 10-15 min walking distance.Stayed in January 2018

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content: ¡°The Hotel is highly recommendable to anybody who is looking for an excellent value of money in Singa¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>1. I expected a better breakfast wit more selections In breads and cheeses.2. The Hotel does not have a gym.<U+B207>1. The staff was really helpful and super friendly.2. The area of the Hotel is lively with great Thaifood places (right in the golden mile district).3. Easy access to the MRT (Nicoll Highway 7 Mins walking, Lavendar (10 Mins walking).4. Excellent view onto the Singapore Flyer, Marina Bay Sands Hotel as well as the Stadium).5. Although in a busy area, the rooms were quiet.6. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had a good size. The shower was bigger than expected.7. Very nice rooftop outdoor pool.8. Taxis from the airport or to the airport cost between S$24-S$29.Stayed in December 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B198>There is no Indian food restaurants nearby. At times calls from room made to front desk goes un attended. During weekends the lifts were fully occupied and we stayed in 8th floor.Literally i had to force my family to squeeze in the lift when it stopped in our floor and i had to take stairs.<U+B200>Hotel is very close to Nicolle Highway Metro station which made our travel easy within city. I would like to thank Mr. Aloysius and Ms. Pei Pei at the front Desk. They were very helpful in providing tips on sight seeing locations. We were allowed to early check-in. The check in and check out process time takes less than 3 minutes. The breakfast was good and it is continental, but it was bit boring to see the same menu daily. The seating area for breakfast was very limited. There is very less option for vegetarians and no option of Indian food, however one day we were lucky to get Channa and parathas. All together the Hotel is in good location, clean but small rooms. Room Service was good. Just across the road there is Hawker food centre and there are no Indian food available. But there is an restaurant adjacent to hawker centre which serves chicken, mutton and fish Biryani and the food was good. Stayed in December 2017

content: ¡°I would choose a different hotel next time¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The free breakfast was not good.  The problem was that food that should be hot like eggs were cold every morning.  Food that should be cold like milk for cereal was warm every morning.  The inability to keep the food at the proper temperature made the breakfast awful.  In addition, I attended the breakfast 45 minutes before the posted closing of breakfast but found that many items had run out and were not replaced--You couldn't get bananas, muffins, Jam, and other items unless you asked a staff member to go into the kitchen and replenish the buffet.  I think the staff should do this without having to be asked by the guest.<U+B200>The staff were friendly and helpful.  I had some business documents that I needed to print and scan and the staff at the front desk printed and scanned the documents for me which was very helpful.  All staff I spoke with were friendly and nice.Stayed in December 2017

tags: <U+2022> Business trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: <U+B200>Very nice hotel for a good price in a good area. Marina bay area is still in walking distance (20 min), A metro station is 5 min walking, and the arab quarter is nearby which offers a lot of restaurants, some bars and food courts. There is a bus station in front of the hotel, and buses to Malaysia leave next door. The pool is very nice, breakfast was very good, I missed nothing.Stayed in November 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 7 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>Bathroom was not cleaned every day and was getting bit dirty in the end of our stay (we stayed 7 nights).<U+B200>Very good location close to a metro station, great swimming pool on the roof, very nice and helpful staff. We like to walk and from the hotel we were able to reach many sights by walking. Great was the food centre just across the street with good and cheap food.Stayed in November 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°Had a pleasant 4-day stay in this hotel.  Will consider staying here again.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Housekeeping could be improved:  washbasin looked like it hadn't been scrubbed well before our occupancy, found a child's toy under the bed which could mean that housekeeping staff hadn't vacuumed under the bed after the previous guests' departure, desk was a bit dusty upon our arrival.  Didn't have separate container for shampoo/conditioner and shower gel in the shower so we didn't know if it was for the hair or body.  Lock of sliding wooden door of the bathroom wasn't working (either broken or deliberately kept that way) which is a privacy concern if you're staying with mixed group.  Definitely needs improvement:  repair of drain beside the toilet where bad smell emanates (had to change room because of this but even the new room given us had this problem).<U+B200>The bed was comfy.  Pillows were soft, towels were fluffy and absorbent.  Room was well insulated from noise. Have lots of wall sockets including USB plugs and universal socket.  Enough drawers and long desk.  Our room has nice view of the river.  Sufficient lighting and airconditioning unit working well.  Conveniently located near shopping complex with taxi stand and hawker center. Quiet neighborhood.  Housekeeping was fast in delivering our requested items.  We'd like to commend front desk staff, Pei Pei, for being accommodating and pleasantly answering our questions.Stayed in November 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Twin Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights
content: ¡°Good location, away from busy areas yet very well served by both MRT and buses.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Although we had a room with a view over a harbour area the outside windows didn't open so the room had a somewhat unventilated feel. Otherwise a very comfortable stay.<U+B200>Location is on a main road with a bus route and a Hawker Centre for tasty food. MRT station is a mere 5 minute walk with lifts to get up to an overhead walkway.Lovely swimming pool with a magnificent view over the city. Plentiful towels provided for swimmers. Breakfast had a good range of different foods including lovely fresh fruit; a good breakfast!Staff were helpful over an additional booking we had made for an additional guest who was arriving very late in the evening.Stayed in November 2017

content: ¡°I liked the breakfast and the service.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Location maybe is not the best for them who want to be in the center of everyrhing.It took about 20min daily to get to night life/shops etc.  About 10 min walk to subway and then 3 stations to Marina bay, or around 5 stations to China town.My favourite Ralph Lauren swimming suite was never found after room cleaning. I hope it wasn't stolen, but taken with the towels by accident, but the fact is that it was never returned back. I am really disappointed with this fact as it is not accurate from personal's side. I was asked several times about it and each time I had to explain same things from the beginning - describe suite, when it disappeared etc. And this didn't had any results. I was explained that laundry service is provided by another company. But this doesn't mean anything when you loose your favourite thing. Only pictures of suite on the rooftop are left. Sad experience.<U+B200>I liked the breakfast and the service. Swimming pool on the rooftop was beautiful. Area is quite. There is some local food available in the next building and huge shopping store in 1 subway station. Bugis if I am not mistaken, we bought clothes, some souvenirs, cosmetics etc from there. Hotel is modern. We stayed 5 days in the room on 14 floor, didn't experience any problems with lift, only once waiting was around 3-5 min. All the rest time it was actually fast.Stayed in November 2017

You can clearly say they just quicly mop the floor to look a<U+0080><U+009C>cleana<U+0080><U+009D> but this area needs proper cleaning after each guest. You could feel how floor was slippery and slime. Something what I didna<U+0080><U+0099>t expect in hotel like this.<U+B200>Hotel is new, nice lobby and front desk area with friendly staff. I guess ita<U+0080><U+0099>s good location in Singapore, I was using UBER or taxi everywhere and it wasnaleays few bugs. You can even walk to see the City Center. Two big shopping malls in walking distance as well.Stayed in November 2017

content: ¡°Terrible staff ! They were train to rip you off!¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>I booked a family room as indicated during the booking process. Anyway the Manager didn't show any empathy and understanding at all, and has no customer service skills. tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B207>Pretty much everything you would expect from a hotel in Singapore, Impeccable cleaning, quite spacious rooms, attention to details, good location, close to Marina Bay, and a big plus - there is an asian food court right outside the building, crossing the street, with cheap prices and very good foodStayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: <U+B209>If you are looking for giant american rooms, and have lots of luggage, this is not for you. The pillows were flat, but I am sure the hotel would have provided more. This is a newish hotel (1.5 years) and the taxis didn't know how to find it. Show them on a map, or say next to golden tower on beach road. If you say the address itself (700 beach road), no problem, they'll get there. That's it! Honestly a great stay!<U+B207>Great hotel, with very good beds. The rooms were small (normal for singapore) but very well designed. We traveled with only carry on, big suitcases might be a problem. Air conditioner cools down the room quickly, quietly and very efficiently. The hotel is right next to little thai, and a great hawker center. There is a 7/11 kitty corner from it. Taxi are readily available day and night. The staff was super friendly, and really amicable. No problem keeping our luggage at 4 AM while we visited the city! The lavender metro is 5-10 minutes walking, or Burgis (more connections) 10-15 minutes, while walking on very cool street. You are right in the arabic part of town, with a great mosque and a palace nearby. Little india is not far either. Rooftop pool has great views, 1.5 meter deep. Lots of room for sunbathing. Lots of chairs. Always enough towels. By taxi, we were 30 minutes from the zoo, 25 minutes from sentosa, and about 20 minutes to the airport. Taxis are really great in singapore. Although breakfast was not included, it was worth it: lots of offerings, varying from continental to semi-local. Highly recommended!Stayed in October 2017

content: ¡°The staff is friendly and the room is cleaned everyday¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>I wanted a stapler to do my tax refund and it wasn't available. I wanted to borrow a scale for my luggage and it wasn't available. The location is 5 minutes by car but 20 mins walk to bugis a bit fa compare to my previous stay in other hotel with similar room price. Prices weren't cheaper and I need to pay extra money for tax. Which I would love to know in Advance by Booking and by Hotel. the price was around 800 SGD and I paid more than 1000 SGD on arrival. Breakfast hall was stunning yet the menu was limited. The 2 rooms I booked, (1) double bed for 2 people ( it's great for 2 people with a small couch), (2) room for 3 people: 1 double bed and 1 single bed, Now this was when I realised my bed is the couch, it's not a real bed which I had expected. Quite disappointed with the hotel facilities.<U+B207>The staff is friendly and the room is cleaned everydayStayed in October 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B209>The rooms were small for a family of 4 and the fridge wasn't cold but that was the only negatives<U+B207>Very good value for money. Great rooftop pool and beautiful views of the gardens, Singapore flyer and Marina Bay Sands Hotel. Local food centre across the road and about a 5 min walk to the Nicoll Highway MRTStayed in October 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night
content: ¡°We loved the view from our room.¡±
content_detail: <U+B207>We loved the view from our room. It overlooked the Marina and we could see the dragon boats during the weekend.  The croissant and danish pastries served at breakfast were delicious! Breakfast choices although limited were very good and filling. They served 3-4 kinds of fruits, bread and pastries with cheeses, jams, butter, yogurt and your choice of freshly brewed coffee. Bottled water in room were replenished every day. Location was just a block away from the MRT station and you can easily request for Uber or Grab. The place is quite new because all the taxis, uber and grab drivers said it was their first time to bring someone there.Stayed in October 2017

content: ¡°A nice three night stay in a good location hotel¡±

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night
content: ¡°Great breakfast menu for Family, clean room, and good neighborhood location¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>We arrived at Lavender station, walked to the beach road and had to climb up the crossing bridge in front of the hotel.  Thankfully we only brought small carry-on. The nearest MRT station is Nicoll Highway but have to walk around changing stations. Check-in was fast although the room is not ready at 12 noon.  We left the bags at hotel reception.<U+B207>Clean room, not too small with 3 beds, toilet with jet washer, quite complete facilities : safe deposit, refrigerator, hairdryer. They can give 3 room key cards. Breakfast menu quite extensive : Asian style with chinese porridge, Western style with sereal, milk, toasted bread, baked beans, scramble eggs, chicken sausage, bacon. Three types of juices (not fresh ones, btw) salad, fruits, yogurts. Although at 9 am they run out of salad n fruits. Wifi is ok in the room, max 3 devices.Only one bus away from Bugis Mall, well actually we can walk about 30 minutes Booked the low rate - no money back kinda risky, but since the rate include breakfast, is a good value !Stayed in October 2017

content: ¡°Just finished a 3 night stay at this hotel and it was...¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The breakfast is expensive <U+B200>Just finished a 3 night stay at this hotel and it was perfect . The hotel is easily located on the mrt from the airport. Arrived at hotel at 9 am on a flight from London and to our surprise they had a room ready for us, so we were checked in right away.I read some reviews about people saying room is tiny , given the room is small but still no problem at all . Excellent views of city from either side of hotel to . The room was cleaned every day and fridge topped up with water too. Swimming pool area is lovely with perfect city views as well. We highly highly recommend.Stayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night<U+2022> Submitted via mobile

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night
content: ¡°Good value. Friendly staff. Room not large but serviceable.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Room is small but for what you pay in Singapore this is sufficient. Could be cleaner and have more written information. There was nothing in the room to guide visitors but staff clarified and helped. Needs more pillows and blankets to choose from in room.<U+B200>Value for money. Travel from airport costs S$20. Staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. Basic but ride and good rate (when I purchased). Happy to stay again. Comfortable bedStayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Business trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content: ¡°Good value for money. Can save you dough for restaurant walk-outs¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Did not try breakfasts: 25-30 SGD seems to be to much for standard continental breakfast.Pool is closing at 10.30 pm - lights on rooftop go off and you can't enjoy the view at night. No toilet on the roof level.Need to cancel pre-authorization policy: I pay only cash and don't give my card details because of long release times in my country - freezing money for 45-60 days makes no sense, actually making you pay twice. I had to settle this individually by contacting the property and getting decision for "one-time exception".<U+B200>Location: between Nicoll (yellow line) and Lavender (green line) stations means that you'll easily get here from airport via MRT and also reach main attractions.Cleanliness: rooms are modern and clean. Request for cleaning is done upon push of button.Lifts seem to be working faster than described in previous reviews, though the waiting time is still around 1-2 mins.Friendly staff - allowed for a later checkout and overall helped with advice, but only after you ask them.Tea and coffee bags refilled regularly along with 2 bottles of water per day.Stayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Business trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Twin Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>Life guard at swimming pool.<U+B200>The pillow and bed are really comfortable, excellent! Location is great. Less than 10 mins walk to Nicoll Highway MRT station, very convenient for business visitors who attend exhibitions or conference at the Marina Bay Sands Exhibition and Convention Centre.Stayed in September 2017

content_detail: <U+B198>As a business traveller, you can stay here as long as you do not require any of their very limited services. Perfect for just sleeping. Eat outside and unfortunately, your are not in the right area for choices...The breakfast is very limited and ...ok, the restaurant do not serve on time. I had to wait one hour to be served...Anyway, I suppose they were busy that day.<U+B200>Very clean and comfy rooms. The terrace with the swimming pool is pleasant.Local restaurants outside are good, if you have cash...:-)Stayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>The roof top pool, though very handy, is small and hardly luxurious. The first room we were given (on the recommendation of the front desk) was supposed to have a river view but instead all we could see was the very ugly high rise building immediately behind the hotel. We were very disappointed when we first saw it and felt it had been oversold! To be fair, when we asked if there was another room available (with a city view) the room was swapped and we were much happier with our new room. Had there not been another one available we would have been very unhappy as, in effect, half the hotel's room have horrible views. While there is nothing the hotel can do about that, it is pretty rich to say the rooms at the back have any kind of view and the price should reflect that.<U+B200>The outstanding feature of the hotel is its location. It is right in the heart of a vibrant part of the city, close to huge number of excellent restaurants and very handy for the MRT (Nicholl Highway stop). The rooms though are small and there was very limited space for luggage with a tiny wardrobe. We didn't eat in the hotel (the price for breakfast was OTT) and there are several very good places nearby including a 24 hour 7 / 11 for everything you might need. We felt very safe wandering around and absolutely loved Singapore.Stayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content: ¡°Nice with good location. MRT and bus access very close by¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The room booked was triple room. However, it had 4 bed, which made the room extra congested with absolutely no space to walk or keep the luggage. We managed as we were just tourists and only went back to sleep. A more spread on breakfast would have been a bonus<U+B200>The staff was really courteous and accommodated us for an hour late check-out as our flight was late in evening. They used to also send extra free water bottles whenever asked for. Breakfast was nice.Stayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Business trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> 2 rooms<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content: ¡°Great modern hotel with amazing rooftop pool¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Rooms are little bit small for three people<U+B200>Simple modern rooms, extremely clean, very close to the MRT station, amazing rooftop pool, great food court across the street, very good value for moneyStayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content: ¡°An excellent location from which to vist this part of Singapore¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Places to eat were within walking distances but we did have to walk two or three blocks to find one that we would enjoy.<U+B200>Breakfast was a good start for the day, covering our dietary needs (vegetarian, European taste) but we felt it was a little expensive.We used public transport a lot and found the MRT (metro) was excellent - very clean, well signed, helpful staff, quick and efficient, cheap. We used a bus to get from the hotel to MacRichie National park with help from the tourist office. You need to use Google Maps to find the right bus stops and where to get on and off.Stayed in September 2017

content: ¡°I really liked the location of the hotel, however was very...¡±
content_detail: <U+B200>I really liked the location of the hotel, however was very disappointed in the size of the rooms. We booked two family rooms and the only difference was they crammed another two beds in the room. Absolutely no space in between the beds and nowhere for your luggage. I even saw a women bringing her luggage out to the hall way to unpack her clothes. Pool area was on the roof top with a spectacular view . Evenings were very pleasant up there but during the day no shade so too hot to be up there. Staff were pleasant enough. Enjoyed our stay.Stayed in August 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>The wi-fi speed could be a lot better. There is the option to purchase faster Internet, however (1) I have to pay, (2) even if I'm willing to pay, I am stuck with the free option and cannot go back to the initial free vs paid menu page.<U+B200>The best thing about this property is the location, as it is very close to Nicoll Highway MRT station, which connects to a whole lot of other great places/stations.The facilities were pretty standard, similar to other hotels/rooms that's of similar price.Overall, it's just right. Safe choice.Stayed in August 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B207>All my pre-arrival requests were granted from the extra pillows to the big bed to be pushed to the wall. Everything was in order upon arrival. Housekeeping never failed to make up our room and replenish everything everyday. Exceptional service from the front desk to f&b especially the Filipina staff at the restaurant and Stomper Lim who even voluntarily put rice on my daughter's plate upon seeing me carrying my baby.  He always checked on us every time we dine for breakfast, never failing to put a contagious smile and a pleasant demeanor. He even gave my daughter a cute souvenir pen. I won't hesitate booking here again the next time I visit sg.Stayed in September 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B209>The hotel deducted twice the amount from my bank account and took payment from my partner. Right now I'm waiting for the bank to refund me my money.The wifi could have been stronger. (It was slow and sometimes inaccessible) The TV shows offered by the hotel was very basic and often on repeat even though it has subscription. USB drive was not recognised by the TV.The temperature of the room tends to get less cooling into the night except for the area just outside the bathroom.<U+B207>The room was clean. The bathroom was clean. (2 shower heads to choose from; one is detachable and the other non-detachable)The view at the rooftop pool is nice. It is near Golden Mile Food Centre and within it there is a selection of yummy food to choose from.Taking the public transport is very convienient. (A short walk is needed to take the train and there is a bus stop near the hotel)Stayed in September 2017

content: ¡°Great value hotel, we enjoyed our stay here¡±
content_detail: <U+B207>We had a very nice room with a water view on the 15th floor. Everything we needed ( except shampoo which would have been helpful). Staff are friendly and helpful. Good breakfast buffet, although a little crowded. Walk to little Arab Street, Raffles, taxi rank next door or MRT in the next street if you want to go further.  We enjoyed our stay.Stayed in August 2017

content_detail: <U+B209>The rooms are very very small for a family. Price for this small room is quite expensive. But all Singapore is too expensive.  Breakfast is busy and crowded. I don't understand why they creat a bigger space. Not much choice to the breakfast.  Only the wifi is nice.<U+B207>The special thing the hotel did for me is this. I forgot 4,800$ in the room safe. And left Singapore. I just remember that when we arrive in Bangkok and call to the hotel. They said they got the money and transfer it for us by western union in the next morning. I really really appreciate their kindness.Stayed in August 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights
content_detail: <U+B209>In between booking the property and arriving the property had changed names and owners. The taxi driver could not find, or know of the change of names so we were a little worried until he said this was the street number but the name of the hotel was Destination.  The restaurant food was not to our taste although the service was good.  We would have appreciated having some details of Singapore etc in the room as hotels usually do.  The reception had no information on what to see in Singapore, this should be addressed immediately so that guests know just where they are and what to see. whilst on their stay.Stayed in August 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content: ¡°We were travelling with a two year old.¡±
content_detail: <U+B207>We were travelling with a two year old. The hotel was exactly what we expected with the price we paid. The room was clean and nicely presented. We hardly spent anytime at the hotel other than sleeping at night and the rooftop pool. The bed was comfy and the pool was great. Our two year old had no problems with safety. The only niggle were the elevators, they seemed to stop on every single floor with nobody waiting. There was a taxi stand next door which we used often and the staff ordered us an uber to the airport which was excellent.Stayed in July 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Twin Room<U+2022> Stayed 8 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B209>LIFTS, LIFTS they are sooooo slooowww, have patience as they open you will find they are full. No umbrellas in pool area, need shade for protection from  sun.<U+B207>Room was excellent, bathroom small but sufficient towels soft and fluffy-no flannel . Always stocked bottles of water in frig, room clean and well maintained. Breakfast was lovely, but not coffee which was terrible. Dinner was amazing food was different an very well prepared. Staff helpful considering the amount of guests passing through the reception area. LOCATION the best across road food plaza, down road is Arab area fantastic, around corner is Nichol Highway MRT, money changers  next door, everything in easy reach.Stayed in July 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night
content: ¡°Excellent hotel for short stay in Singapore¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The hotel is very busy and they probably need a larger breakfast area to accommodate the number of people staying. The buffet breakfast is very good but they struggled to replenish a lot of food items sometimes, and so we had to wait for a while. However all breakfast staff did their best and tried to be helpful.<U+B200>This is a very busy high rise hotel in central Singapore. It is a new hotel and therefore the accommodation is clean and modern, although the rooms are a little small. All bathroom fittings were new and worked very well. The staff are very efficient and friendly - I inadvertently left my handbag in the taxi taking us to this hotel and the staff immediately moved heaven and earth to get it returned to me, which they did. This was amazing service. The hotel is within walking distance of popular tourist destinations like Raffles and also very close to a train station where you can get transport further into town which we found very easy to use. This is a very convenient hotel for a short stay in Singapore.Stayed in August 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content_detail: <U+B200>We arrived early from a long flight from Paris and were very grateful to be able to check in several hours early. From other reviews we understood that when the room was configured for 4 there would be almost no other space, the beds are more or less touching each other like one long bed and very little space for luggage etc. Knowing this in advance we were able to plan and left our main suitcases at the "left luggage" storage facility at the airport, as we were only there for 3 days, our hand luggage was plenty. This worked out really well, and we were very comfortable in our room. We loved the rooftop pool, this added a touch of luxury and excitement for the children, extra towels were provided at the poolside which was a great service, and the opening hours were long enough to take advantage of it after a long day of sightseeing. You can see a lot of view from the roof, including the Marina Bay Sands and the Domes. Across the road (and there is an bridge from the lobby) there is the Golden Mile Hawker centre with many food options available, as well as a mall of sorts along the road. We felt the location was great, easy to get around.Stayed in July 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>Only problem I found was some taxi drivers didn't know where this hotel was. Once you tell them the street they find it pretty easily, but I think the name recently changed and so they aren't as familiar with it yet.<U+B200>Very nice business like hotel. Reminds me of a Holiday Inn. The bed was very comfortable, the shower was lovely, the breakfast was delicious. Does the job very well. All the amenities were nice, and the room was very clean. The location was also great.  MRT within walking distance, a really great Hawker Centre across the street, Arab Street is a few minutes walk away where you can find many bars and restaurants. I really enjoyed my stay here.Stayed in July 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> 2 rooms<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights
content: ¡°Smelly bathroom that wasn't fixed during 4 days of stay¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>I complained about a foul smelling drain in the bathroom on 4 occasions during my 4 night stay with the hotel not addressing this at all before I left and we had to cover the drain with towels each night. They finally sent someone up at 22:30 on the last night when I was trying to get some sleep ready for an early flight next day. This is the first and last 'Destination' hotel we will ever stop in - it really blighted a trip to a fantastic country.Breakfast 'special rate' is also not good value for money for a family of 4.<U+B200>The hotel is close to 2 metro stations and a local food court (Hawker Centre)Stayed in July 2017

content_detail: <U+B198>Bed was very hard but staff did bring extra pillows when requested.Drinks expensive and lounge was not restful so tended to head up to the pool to sit and relax but we needed to head back down for amenities or refreshments. tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>The cleanliness of the room could have been a bit better. When we first went into our room the smell of the toilet was in a bad state. I had also dropped something on the floor and when I bent down with a torch to search under the bed was greeted with a dusty carpet and left over items from previous guests. The swimming pool at the roof is also very shallow at 1.2 meters (which may be beneficial or preferred to some people). The lifts were also extremely slow - you definitely had to wait several minutes before it arrives after pressing the button. The breakfast area is also way to small for the number of guests the hotel accommodates for. The breakfast buffet area was overly crowded and at times chaotic in the morning as several guests try to get their food in a non-orderly fashion. I also witnessed an argument from guests who had taken other guest's tables at breakfast time as sometimes tables have to be shared due to the number of people.<U+B200>The staff were helpful and friendly with all questions relating to the local area and accommodation.  The hotel is situated approximately 10-15 minutes walk from Lavender Station which I found more well connected than the closest station which was about 5 minutes walk away. There are 7/11's and other 24 hour stores a short walk away which was very convenient. The breakfast buffet is a convenient way to get breakfast without having to go out. I liked that they provided towels on the roof for the swimming pool and that the outdoor pool was very clean. The wifi is also very good and I had no broken connections throughout my entire stay.Stayed in July 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>Sometimes a bit long waiting for elevator.<U+B200>Centrally located. Close to metro station. Only 3 stopps to Beach Rd. Pool on roof. Medium size room. Good shover.Stayed in July 2017

Great swimming pool on the roof to enjoy the sun during the morning (not enough chairs but it avoid to have many people on the swimming pool). Knowing that Singapore is not a cheap city, this accommodation is a great value for money!Stayed in July 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 8 nights
content_detail: <U+B200>The hotel was very conveniently located near the Nicoll Hwy MRT which made it very easy to get around Singapore. We visited some other busier areas and were glad to be staying in a quieter location. There were plenty of cheap, easy and delicious dining options close by across the road at the Golden Mile Food Centre and at the Thai centre next to the hotel. I would definitely stay here again if I was to visit Singapore.Stayed in July 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 7 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>Extra beds/mattresses are not provided.  These should be provided.  Rooms are a little compact.  Microwave in the room would have been helpful.  The reception is on the first level, so you would have to take an elevator or climb steps, which can be a little annoying at times.  Also there is no grandness in the entrance of the hotel.  There is no bellboy/staff service to assist you with the luggage, the same has to be managed on our own.<U+B200>Cleanliness was nice.  View from the room was awesome.  Free mineral water saved a lot of money or effort to go and purchase.  The staff was very courteous and helpful at all times.  A short walking distance from MRT Station was helpful for easy commute.  The entrance to the hotel is very practical, taxi can drop you right at the doorstep.   Luggage carts are provided for transporting luggage within the hotel premises.  Free wifi was helpful.Stayed in July 2017

content: ¡°Will book this for our next stay in Singapore¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The dining room was closed other than breakfast due to renovations This renamed hotel had a large number of unruly families who thought nothing of allowing their children to door crash from room to room long after midnight ...whilst not the hotels fault, they did speak to these guests but it took a number of us barging into their unlocked rooms asking them to stop the screaming and put their children to bedFrom my last visit, they seemed to have made some contracts with a large ethnic group who have little regard for other guestsI hope this will be looked at in the future as I will still gladly stay again<U+B200>A nice no fuss  hotel, easy access to our rooms which were very comfy with an excellent bathroom ....a taxi rank right next door but no issues with the hotel arranging 4 taxis for our transfer to our cruise ship This hotel was a short taxi ride to the hop on hop off bus and other attractions with a supermarket next door....we loved the Asian mall which allowed us to eat with the locals and very good it was tooStayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>Space!! The room was great for 1 or two people. The fact that we booked as a family would mean we need a bit more room. This became an issue in the bathroom. There was no space at all to put any toiletries. Some extra bench space or shelving in there would have been great.Also, the fridge never gets cold. I think our water was lucky to get to about 10 degrees. That was really annoying when you just want a nice cold drink. Also, again, space. Could only fit 4 small 600ml bottles of water in there.The pool closes at 10pm which is slightly annoying. The city doesn't stop until 10pm, so after a long day walking around taking in the city it wold have been nice to go back and chill in the pool for a little bit, but it closes at 10pm. The elevator won't let you press Rooftop after that time.The room didn't include breakfast. A friend booked a room for 6 nights including breakfast and paid less than we did for 4 nights without breakfast, so that was really disappointing.<U+B200>The rooftop pool was fantastic.One of the few places in Singapore that accommodates families and we could all get into one room. Although a little squashy, it didn't bother us too much as we only really went back there to sleep.It is reasonably close to Nicholl Hwy MRT station.12noon checkout is so good!Stayed in June 2017

content: ¡°The location is great, walking distance to many city centre...¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The hotel had recently changed name and possibly owners, and there was no information at all, for example about nearly shops or tourist attractions, in the rooms. Our room was very, very small, and needed a brighter main light/lighting. There was great variety for breakfast, but I felt S$22 per person was a bit high-priced. A small coffee maker in the room or perhaps downstairs at reception would be a great addition!<U+B200>The location is great, walking distance to many city centre attractions, and the staff were friendly. The pool was great, but quite crowded except for early in the morning.Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content: ¡°An affordable option for a quality stay in Singapore¡±
content_detail: <U+B200>Great value for money, considering we are in Singapore. Good location next to the metro station and some places to eat. Breakfast is a buffet-type one, it does not have a huge variety of meals but it is assorted enough and of an excellent quality. The rooftop swimming pool is nice as well.Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B198>Staff bland. Not friendly. Requested early check in and told no which is understandable. Room not ready by 2. Came back at 2.40 with very tired kids. Still not ready. Moved to room to n lowest level with no city view as advertised. No apology. Take it or leave it and wait another hour at least. Very small and cluttered reception area. Hotel could be great with a few minor tweaks. Bar staff very friendly<U+B200>Very comfy beds. Roof pool. Luggage storage. Good price.Stayed in June 2017

content: ¡°Good Location but only basic and overcrowded facilities¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>1. The breakfast restaurant of the hotel is always heavily crowded. Everyday, one has to wait in a queue to be seated. Breakfast menu choices are limited and it is almost the same on all the days of the week.2. The property charged the full tariff for 6 nights to my credit card more than a month ahead of my stay at the time of booking (instead of just blocking the amount for payment security). I had to pay to my credit card issuer even before I stayed in the hotel. Further, this deprived me of the option to pay the hotel bill by Forex Card to avoid the 3.5% cross currency charge of credit card issuer.<U+B200>Property location is at walking distance from Nicoll Highway MRT. Marina, bay front, Sentosa, Raffles, Vivo city, China Town, Little India etc are just few MRT stations away.Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 8 nights
content_detail: <U+B198>Nothing<U+B200>Excellent very clean new hotelValue for money.Staff is very helpful.Very well located with lots and lots of eatery option all around the hotel.MRT (Metro Train) station (Nicoll Highway) very near to the station (walking distance)Hotel located very centrally in the mid of main Singapore.Beautiful roof top swimming poolA small supermarket just next to hotel for all day to day needsTaxi Stand next to hotel in the supermarketRoom was cleaned dailySmall Fridge in the roomWater electric kettle in room for making teaComplimentary water bottles given every day during our stay Complimentary tea bags+ coffee sachets given every dayLocation of the hotel is just EXCELLENT !!!!Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B198>One of the rooms was not ready until 1.5 hours after check in time. We had to go down and check constantly to see when it was available as staff were not in too much of a rush to have it ready. The room was booked 3 months prior yet on the day could not give us side by side rooms as requested. The room had not been cleaned properly. A large water bottle was under the bed, used and unused tissues, crisps and rubbish. When the foldaway bed was put away (which was touching the two beds because the room was so small) and after the cleaner had cleaned the room again, more crisps and rubbish were located on the floor. The carpets were filthy and the bathroom dirty. The toilet door could not lock as it was broken. There was two adults in our room. First day we received an adequate amount of towels and toiletries, upon cleaning they took all of the towels and replaced it with two. More of an inconvenience than anything as we arrived home around 10.30pm from the night safari. Free internet is provided at a slow speed. If you want internet at a speed you can work with you must pay $20.<U+B200>There's not too much good to come out of this hotel unfortunately. One staff member at the front was lovely however she was the only one. The others were outright rude.Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Twin Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content: ¡°Make Destination Beach Road your destination while in Singapore¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The only inconvenience was the bed by the wall in the twin room in Rm 1323. It gave me such a backache. Thankfully I had the other bed which did not give me the problem<U+B200>You can't get more central to the city than the location of Destination. The hotel stay met all my requirements beyond expectation. The reception staff were super polite and accommodating. The linen was pure white, changed every 2 days. The gel soap dispenser is a brilliant idea. The TV had a choice of channels all of which worked.  The food court opp was a bonus. More than anything else, I could not hear any noise from any other guests once I closed my door.  Yay! I realise this is a relatively new hotel but please maintain the cleanliness of the bathroom, walls, carpet etc. because I intend to return and have told everyone of Destination.Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 1 night
content_detail: <U+B198>No frills in the sense of no room service if you get hungry in the middle of the night or want ice cubes to chill a bottle of wine. However, for the price, one can hardly complain.The lifts are alittle slow, small and few for a hotel of such size. Especially during the morning rush for breakfast, the lift stops at every floor regardless of how full it already is.<U+B200>Its a new property, opened only in 2016 I believe. Clean, simple and modern.  Rooms are pretty spacious, with a couch next to the window. Interestingly, the breakfast buffet platters have descriptions in both English and Hindi. Go down early for breakfast to avoid the crowd. Also, the pool is on the roof, which offers a nice view of the surrounding areas.Destination Hotel is located right next to Goldenmile complex which serves authentic thai cuisine, and is opposite from Beach Road Hawker Centre, which serves authentic singapore fare at wallet friendly prices.Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B198>Nothing much.<U+B200>Best value for a family trip. We were a couple with 2 kids and the 3 beds in family roomwere extremely comfortable for all 4 of us. The location is excellent with Nicole Highway MRT walking distance from the hotel. We were told at checkin that breakfast for kids will be charged but on clarifying the online offer the kids were offered free breakfast with adults ( we didn't try the breakfast though). The rooftop swimming pool was a delight and view was excellent. The rooms were cleaned daily and the coffee maker was a boon during the rains. Will surely be back again.Stayed in May 2017

Lots of delicious food at very reasonable prices. Lots of locals so just go to where the lines are longer.:)Stayed in June 2017

content: ¡°Our stay in Destination Singapore Beach Road made our family vacation short and sweet.¡±
content_detail: <U+B200>We got a family room and it was so comfortable for the four of us.  Our two kids have their own beds and we had our own queen bed.  Though our Singapore escapade was quite tiring due to a lot of walking and strolling, going back to our room is so comforting and relaxing. Their staff were also accommodating and helpful.  We definitely recommend this hotel.Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 9 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B198>A communal smoking area, but I understand that may put others off.<U+B200>Great location, staff delightful and very helpful, swimming pool amazing - spotlessly clean with fab views, excellent and varied breakfast buffet with hot dishes all being refilled before empty, and plenty of fruit, cheeses, cold meats and pastries.  Some  areas being updated which will be good for everyone, but punches way above its weight, far more than a budget hotel. Thank you Dest.Stayed in June 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°Great for a short stay, if a little cramped¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>10 to 15 minute wait for the lifts in the morning (which wasn't optional as we were on a high floor with 2 small children). Lego and bits of food under the bed (our children appreciated the Lego, not so much the food!). In 4 days, we didn't find a single taxi driver who had heard of the hotel or knew where it was (both as 'Destination' and 'Premier Inn'). The family room had adequate beds but it was very cramped and they took up ALL of the space in the room. There was nowhere to put an open suitcase (except for on the bed) and we literally had to get onto the bed to pass each other in the room.<U+B200>Children ate free at breakfast. Breakfast reasonably priced and had a good selection. Decent location. Beds more than adequate for 2 adults and 2 children. Quick check in and check out.Stayed in May 2017

content_detail: <U+B198>The staff in check in desk wasn't pleasant. She looks tired but that's not a reason to be unfriendly to guests. Try to smile.  The family room was a bit small for 4 people. content_detail: <U+B198>The family room becomes a bit cramped when you have 4, but good value hotel for a family room. Shower was a bit mouldy on the floor. content: ¡°Good value and functional hotel. Well worth consideration.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Bathroom was a little small, but functional. Breakfast buffet was fairly basic but the food was good.<U+B200>This place is value for money. It has a rooftop swimming pool that has nice views. Room was a good size with a large tv. Short taxi ride to good shopping malls. Easy walk across pedestrian road bridge to many small local food stalls.  Late check out given upon request.Stayed in May 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content: ¡°Good hotel and nice location cant say excellent¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>A bell boy would be vetter to carry the luggage to the room and some smiling staff at reception will definitely make the place more livelyStayed in May 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content_detail: <U+B198>Room is small and a little cramped for a family room. The beds occupy the entire space and very little space to walk around without stumbling on each other especially with the kids. Quite disappointed also with the pool as it was smaller compared to when to see it in the pictures. Reception/ lobby is rather small and not much space for people waiting for check in/check out and with all the luggages deposited. It's also odd that lobby is in the 2nd floor. The space in the 1st floor could be utilized for the lobby and retain dining in the 2nd, to give more room. Just a suggestion. e<U+009F><U+0098><U+0089> Also but maybe because of the recent rebranding, a little marketing on the new name might help. We keep on saying taxi/grab/uber that previously it's premier inn, and that's when they sort of know, but not as destination hotel. Or we just tell them near golden mile tower. a<U+0098>o<U+00EF><U+00B8><U+008F><U+B200>Location is good. Very near the bus station and there's a good food center in front. Room is clean and well provided with the sheets and towels. Good idea on the soap dispenser instead of the tiny packets of soap/shampoo other hotels usually have. Staff are friendly and allowed us to leave baggage after check out.Stayed in May 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Twin Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°The fact that I was woken up by drilling above my head the...¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The fact that I was woken up by drilling above my head the first night I stayed there. After calling to complain they promptly said that they are sorry and that they will investigate. Even though the drilling stopped after 15-20 min after my call my morning was ruined. And then again by the member of the staff on the second morning who so desperately wanted to come into my room even though I had a latch in place. When I was checking-out I was never asked if I was happy with my stay or if there was something that could be improved. Definitely not worth coming back.Stayed in May 2017

content_detail: <U+B198>Bathroom a tad small, but it makes the room more comfortable & roomier. The only thing I had an issue with is the water pressure & overly hot water in my 15/F room. Pressure was low & could only turn the dial ever so slightly for tolerable warm water. Maybe this is not the case in lower level rooms? Don?t really know. At the very least the water pressure should be recrified asap<U+B200>Very central. Nearby food court & some stores nearby for your needs. Hj.Lane super cool area as well to unwind the night. Hotel very clean & comfortable, so is the case with the rooms. Value for money in my opinion. Stayed in May 2017

content: ¡°Very comfortable bed, good value for money stay.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>We like to swim in a pool, rather than just lounge, so a bigger pool would have been nice, but we knew the size of the pool when we booked.<U+B200>Booked this location because it was a Premier Inn at time of boooking, knowing that Premier Inn always provides a comfortable, fairly firm bed. We were worried to find out the hotel had changed names a couple of days before we arrived (and no one had thought to tell us), particularly worried about the bed situation, but we needn't have been. The bed was extremely comfortable. Staff helpful and friendly. Close to a metro station and a couple of stops takes you in to Marina Bay Sands area. Also easy to walk into downtown area if you have the time. Breakfast good and appeared competitively priced for restaurants. Cheap local food court across the road if you fancy something different. Served us well the morning we arrived and we had missed breakfast!Stayed in May 2017

content_detail: <U+B198>However, we realized that the hand bidet sprayer was dismantled / taken off (from the toilet) and confirmed by the front desk staff that this was done in line with the re-branding of the hotel... Unless they replace the toilets with automatic shower bidets, I will probably think twice before booking this hotel again.<U+B200>Stayed at this hotel twice before this.  We opted for this hotel due to various reasons, one of which was the location, as it is across the Golden Mile foodcourt where the famous and best Singaporean bone steak can be found.Stayed in April 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 7 nights
content: ¡°Cosy, quiet room, good value for family of four.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>We paid for breakfast on the first day, but it wasn't worth $23/adult, even though kids did eat free. We didn't eat breakfast there again. If it had been a better standard of food then we might have paid to eat there again (the bacon was not crispy, the cooked tomatoes were hard not soft, there were only scrambled eggs, the coffee was from a push button machine, not brewed, small selection of food). The cleaner on the second day did not seem to speak english, took one of our room cards by mistake, and did not remove our used towels.<U+B200>Room was very quiet. Extra thick doors,  and a notice by the lift asking for quiet between 10pm and 7am. Close to public transport (MRT) and also easy to get a taxi from the Golden Mile complex next door. Very good cheap Thai food available at the Golden Mile Complex. The shower was very good. Location is good. Room is quite small, but our family of four stayed for seven days without a problem (and we are quite fussy). Very nice view of the river. Blackout curtains very good. Friendly, helpful reception staff.Stayed in April 2017

content: ¡°Fair value for money. Very good location. Accessible.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>No halal food for muslim guests.Wifi was not good. It was hard to connect and too slow. You have to stay at the lobby in order to have a good connection. And I hope they would have a more friendly staff like mirah, accommodating and kind to whatever race their guests may came from.<U+B200>The location was excellent. Just go outside from the first level and you will find the bus rides on the other side. So many bus to choose from and to take you where you want to go. The mrt ride is just a few minute walk maybe 5-8 minutes and you will reach nicole highway station.Near kampong glam, arab street and bugis. and the fahtima mosque is just a walk away, You just have to go thru the overpass that is connected directly to the hotel and on the other side you will find the masjid. Good for muslims because it is also a walk from  halal foods that were abundant on the lower ground of the building below the overpass. We appreciate one staff on the front desk named mirah cause she was kind and accommodating. However, for muslims don't eat at the hotel because it might not be halal. Overall the hotel was good, being at the center, it's near to every good locations when going around in Spore. Every location is just a walk or mrt ride awaye<U+009F><U+0098><U+0081>e<U+009F><U+0098><U+0081>e<U+009F><U+0098><U+0081> and lots of money chang<U+00C3>¡§r nearby.Stayed in April 2017

The kingsize bed and the single bed took up nearly all the floor space.<U+B200>The main bed was full king size and very comfortable, TV was large,  room was cleaned well every day, rooftop pool was fine, reception staff were helpful, printed boarding passes, etc  quickly and did not charge for them, Golden Mile Food Centre (for a variety of food stalls...most dishes were around 4-5 Singapore dollars) was right across the street, accessible by an overhead walkway; also ..next door to the hotel were several as  Thai restaurants, a convenience store as well as travel agents.  Marina Bay is a half hour walk or about a $10 taxi ride away, metro and bus stops are a short walk from the hotel.Stayed in April 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 4 nights
content: ¡°Location was convenient and close to multiple MRT stations.¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Rooms can be a little more practical. E.g. some towel rails etc would have been very helpful. no hand bidets BTW! No shampoo/ conditioner were provided.<U+B200>Location was convenient and close to multiple MRT stations. Was also walking distance to the Arab Street area which has a lot of restaurants. Room was rather small (though this is usual in Singapore) but comfortable and cozy. The bed was nice and comfortable and the couch next to the window was a treat. Towels were comfy and fluffy. The rooftop pool was nice. You can get a good night's sleep as there are no loud noises from the surrounding area or other guests. Family friendly place. On request I got a room with a lovely view, which made a huge difference, and there was a lot of natural light coming into my room. Would definitely return.Stayed in March 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Solo traveller<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content: ¡°A good hotel within easy reach of town¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Was initially allocated an uncleaned room in error but thanks to the helpful staff at reception that was soon sorted. The lifts were very busy and sometimes you had to wait a long time for one to arrive!<U+B200>Good quality accommodation at a reasonable price for Singapore standards. Only a 5-minute walk to Nicoll Highway metro station and, if you don't mind walking in the heat, you can walk along Beach Road to the City Centre in about 30 minutes.Stayed in March 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Twin Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°Not the best Premier Inn I've stayed in but good enough¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>The bathroom was relatively small and the shower layout means it's difficult not to wet the floor near the door. The wifi was ok but cut off a few times during our stay. Of most concern during our stay was the price of the breakfasts, which came to around <U+00C2>¡ê25 each morning for two people to eat which seemed quite extortionate. However there are no utensils in the room (save for tea and coffee making facilities) meaning it's difficult to buy milk or cereal to have a much cheaper breakfast in the room. The other option is to go out for breakfast which we ended up doing eventually. Also on one morning when we did have the breakfast we were greeted and sat down and told the price would be even more expensive than the day before, which we thought was strange. We finished the meal, and instead of asking to pay with the staff member who seated us, I went to the reception desk to pay there, as I'd done the day before. Here I was charged the same price as previously. After sitting back down before leaving the hostess came over to ask if we wanted to pay and I explained we had already, she looked a bit put out and went over to the reception desk where she appeared to have strong words with the receptionist, apparently for not over-charging us. The whole situation seemed a bit off, so be careful with that if you stay here.<U+B200>I've stayed in a lot of Premier Inn's in the UK and so booked into this one based on it being one of the more affordable hotels in a quite expensive city, and with the knowledge that I knew what kind of experience I was in for. On arrival the staff allowed us to upgrade from a queen bed room to a king size room which was nice. The rooms themselves are not that large however - big enough for us but others might want a bit more space. The bed was comfortable and the pool on the roof was nice enough, although the weather was a bit hit and miss during our stay (as i got the impression it tends to be in Singapore) so came across as a little cold and windy. Location was good, we were able to walk into the main central area of the city within about 20-30 minutes, but took the nearby metro on a couple of occasions too. There are loads of nice restaurants in the area around the hotel, so plenty of choice there.Stayed in March 2017

content: ¡°Good location with serious hygienic and cleanliness issue¡±
content_detail: <U+B198>Serious issue with the hygienic and cleanliness. I had "used" woman's underware fall off from where the hotel kept the spare pillows in the wardrobe. It was tuck in between the 2 pillows.  I called the front desk and house keeper came offered to "change" the pillow case" for me. Few minutes later the shift manger came and apologised offered to change the room and breakfast will be a compliment. She transferred me to another room and this is where I stepped on someone's else toe nails in the second room. I could not be bother complain anymore. If the pillow's case has been changed then the underware shouldnt be there. I think as a hotel, pillow cases should be changed every time when they guests check out and new one came in.<U+B200>It is not far from the MRT station, there are restaurants within walking distance. Located in quiet street. The breakfast was okay.Stayed in March 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Couple<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 5 nights
content_detail: <U+B209>There is a window in the room, but the view is very limited due to a nearby building of Golden Mile complex (but from the roof you can see Marina Bay).There is a 50 SGD deposit for every day of stay, although I must admit that it was returned to my card in only three operational days which is much better than hotels averagely do.Doors on the second floor (near the reception) are closed at night so you have to go to the first floor.Looks a bit expensive to me, but may be it's just Singapore prices.<U+B207>Very nice and friendly personnel. The hotel is new and very clean. Photos of the rooms are up-to-date.The location is not excellent, but many attractions are easily accessible. Nicoll Highway MRT station of Circle Line (yellow) is about 400m away. This line will easily take you to Marina Bay. Downtown, China Town and Little India also can be reached in a reasonable time by MRT (line change required). Lavender MRT station of East West Line (green) is about 800m away (if you make a shortcut by Pedestrian Bridge over Rochor River). This line takes you to the Changi Airport in about 50 minutes. Use bus No.100 to go to Sentosa, the stop is about 50m from the hotel. Big food center and ATMs just across the road (use bridge from the second floor). Pass the food center and you'll find a post office, post boxes and a 24/7 SAM machine (you can buy stamps here).Good soundproof of the rooms. Quiet air-conditioning which can be regulated from the room. Very comfort bed and nice linen.Swimming pool on the roof was ok. Rather small to have a good swim but enough wake you up in the morning or relax at the end of day.Luggage room is free of charge.Stayed in March 2017

content: ¡°Great room - enough space for two people, very comfortable...¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>The elevators! There are 3 elevators but seem not enough for this hotel. Arm yourself with a lot of patience or take the stairs.The breakfast is too pricey. There are better options nearby (try Maison Ikkoku in the Arab neighbourhood or Tolido's, they are excelent breakfast places and not pricey at all).<U+B207>Great room - enough space for two people, very comfortable bed, free water, really quiet (had a room on the 9th floor).8-10 minutes on foot to the Nicoll Highway MRT station that is on the yellow Circle Line.Stayed in March 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content: ¡°Great for Couples but NOT for families!!¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>Having stayed in a Family Room at the Premier Inn, Kingston Upon Thames, we were expecting a very similar facility. However, this was NOT the case. Upon entering our room, we discovered that what had been sold as a FAMILY ROOM, was in fact, a standard room with 4 beds SQUEEZED into it. There was absolutely no room to move around. We had 5 suitcases, as we had just spent 4 weeks travelling around Europe, and there was barely enough space to place 2 of them on the floor. Also, the view from the windows (on both sides of the building), look out onto the neighbouring buildings. There was so little room, that the Housekeeping staff just pulled the quilts up and tucked them down between the beds. They changed the towels and this was the extent of "cleaning". The restaurant downstairs was located in the same area as the Reception desk. This meant that while you were eating breakfast, you were subjected to the constant (and at times LOUD), noise of large groups of people checking in and out of the hotel. You would also have to manoeuvre your way past several large stacks of luggage that people had left for the hotel staff to "hold". Breakfast in the hotel was also the most expensive we had encountered on our holiday. At SGD23.50 per adult (kids ate FREE), it was a very average selection of dishes to choose from. We found that if the restaurant was full, there wasn't a lot of space to move between tables, and even less when people had their prams seated by their tables. I would not recommend this facility for families (especially those with young ones).<U+B207>The staff at the Premier Inn Singapore Beach Road were very welcoming and extremely helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent, with the Nicoll Hwy MRT just around the corner (5 minute walk). It is also not far from Bugis Street markets and eateries. Great place for couples.Stayed in March 2017

content: ¡°Good hotel, great location and great value for money¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>There are three lifts and one was out of order when we were checking out. It took really long to get a lift. I then requested a cake and was told that I need to make the request three days in advance and they asked if I'd like a slice of cake for S$9. I declined that offer as I was very disappointed<U+B207>This hotel is perfectly located close to the Nicol highway mrt so we were able to get to all the touristy places with ease. They allowed us early check in as our flight arrived really early and we were suffering from jet lag. They made up the sleeper couch as a second bed for our daughter. The room was clean and there were great views of the city and the bay. Shops are close by for cheap food.Stayed in February 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Group<U+2022> Superior Queen Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights
content: ¡°Really Disappointing service from a promising facility¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>For such a great physical facility the customer service is really a let down. Staff always seemed distracted and when they did assist with a simple request, it seemed like such an effort, except for one lovely lady who really stood out on my last day (I wish I had remembered to take her name.) I arrived in the evening for my stay just after midnight and no one assisted me with my bags so I struggled to my room. They didn't even offer or say sorry no one is available.  On arrival they hadn't deducted my payment (as all the other booking.com hotels usually do) as they were trying to add an additional $100 SGD as a security deposit which I was told was in case I ate at the restaurant which I had no intention of doing. It wasn't an issue of me not having the money. I use a separate debit card when I travel for all my accommodation and tour costs to come off of so I transfer money to it based on the invoices costs. I had allocated for  the Singapore system of adding hotel taxes etc. I just wish they had communicated this prior to my arrival so that I could have planned accordingly or transferred money across the day before. Also no free breakfasts or any added value. Advice: Get a service offering to match your promising facility and learn to go the extra mile and communicate any possible causes for inconvenience beforehand!!!<U+B207>Given the high cost of accommodation in Singapore the Premier Inn offers a good price for a great facility. The hotel is new so everything is still in good condition. The room was great with a big comfortable bed. The bathroom could have been bigger but given that it is Singapore I guess it was OK. It is also conveniently located about 5 minutes from the subway and a short ride from the Marina Bay hotspot area.Stayed in January 2017

content: ¡°Nice and Clean! Hotel accomodated to our request for room to be near lift.¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>We wondered how she came up with $210.80 when the booking online was $178 before tax. Why would they need the ID of all the 4 guests and made it kind of a hassle?? The manager on duty also looks very strict.<U+B207>We like the free parking and the kids love the vehile lift that brought us to the carpark! The bedsheets were clean and ample towels were given. 4 bottles of mineral water were given and chilled in advance for you in the bar fridge. Good quality hairdryer was also provided. The auto torchlight was another little surprise. The rooftop was extremely relaxing and towels were also available on all the deck chairs. Overall great experience, just that the front desk lady spoke with a strong korean accent and I had a hard time trying to understand.Stayed in January 2017

tags: <U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Triple Room<U+2022> Stayed 2 nights<U+2022> Submitted via mobile
content: ¡°Cheap hotel, with low quality service. Dont expect too much!¡±
content_detail: <U+B209>Check in: We came before 13:30 and the staff immediately refuse us because the check in time is 2pm. Finally i said can we just fill all the form and later take? At the end 2pm inside lobby is like in market, because all guest would like to get the key.There is no smile, and they are all busy chit chat with each other at the back. Only 1 senior who can handle it more properly.Cleanliness: This is the worst part of this hotel.Once we go inside bathroom, we can smell 'sour smelly' from the toilet. We tried not to compalain first and write down message in piece of paper. And on the next day, its still same very stinky smell, and we just realize all the corner of the bathroom is not properly cleaned, there is a lot of deposit.Also during first night both of us feel our skin is very itchy, but no wonder because on the second day we realize that they never vacum clean the carpet, there is a lot of small particle at corner.Dust bin also not cleaned properly as we can found chocolate waste from our previous night.<U+B207>Its consider new hotel, and the price Price consider lower compare with other hotelStayed in January 2017

tags: <U+2022> Leisure trip<U+2022> Family with young children<U+2022> Family Room<U+2022> Stayed 3 nights
content_detail: <U+B209>We booked a 'family room' to sleep four, but a larger room would probably suit most families of 4 better, or be for a short stay. Our beds were arranged as queen/portable/single sofa and this layout means that there is virtually no floor space at all, we had to have a suitcase under the desk.<U+B207>The price was right, probably because I booked before the hotel opened. Rooftop pool area was pleasant to relax in at the end of the day.The adult breakfast rates include kids for free, and the breakfasts are great to start the day with. Overall the location was fine but we did feel a bit 'off the pace'. Taxis are easy and cheap to get but we did not do much in the area around the hotel.Stayed in January 2017
